Adult_Dosing.text:
40-79.9 kg: 40 mg PO x1
Start within 48 hours of symptom onset
Avoid co-administration with dairy products, calcium supplements
>80 mg: 80 mg PO x1
Start within 48 hours of symptom onset
Avoid co-administration with dairy products, calcium supplements

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Approved for use in pediatric patients 12 and older
40-79.9 kg: 40 mg PO x1
Start within 48 hours of symptom onset
Avoid co-administration with dairy products, calcium supplements
>80 mg: 80 mg PO x1
Start within 48 hours of symptom onset
Avoid co-administration with dairy products, calcium supplements

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Category
: Not assigned (insufficient data)
Lactation risk
: Avoid use while breastfeeding

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult and Pediatric:
CrCl>50: no adjustment
CrCl<50 or HD/PD: not defined

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult and Pediatric:
Child-Pugh Class A or B: no adjustment
Child-Pugh Class C: not defined

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 79.1 hours
Metabolism: liver (CYP450)
Excretion: Feces (predominant), urine
[1]

Comments.text:
Only approved for patients >12 years old and >40kg in weight, no current safety data exists for pregnancy and breastfeeding.
[2]
More expensive but one time dosing. Genentech, its creator, states a recent phase III trial has shown it to be effective for prophylaxis but not currently FDA indicated for this.
